member.name: T:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Exceptions.Agent365Exception
member.summary: Base exception for all Agent365 CLI errors. Provides structured error information for consistent user-facing error messages. Follows Microsoft CLI best practices (Azure CLI, dotnet CLI patterns).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Exceptions.Agent365Exception.ErrorCode
member.summary: Unique error code for this error type (e.g., "CONFIG_INVALID", "AUTH_FAILED"). Used for programmatic error handling and documentation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Exceptions.Agent365Exception.IssueDescription
member.summary: Human-readable description of what went wrong.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Exceptions.Agent365Exception.ErrorDetails
member.summary: List of specific error details (e.g., validation errors).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Exceptions.Agent365Exception.MitigationSteps
member.summary: Suggested mitigation steps to resolve the error.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Exceptions.Agent365Exception.Context
member.summary: Additional context data for error reporting (optional). Example: file paths, resource names, etc.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Exceptions.Agent365Exception.ExitCode
member.summary: Exit code to return when this exception is caught at the entry point. Default: 1 (generic error).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Exceptions.Agent365Exception.IsUserError
member.summary: Whether this is a user error (validation, config issue) vs system error (bug). User errors suppress stack traces in output.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Exceptions.Agent365Exception.BuildMessage(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Build exception message for logging (includes all structured data).

member.summary: Get formatted error message for CLI output (user-friendly, no technical jargon).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Exceptions.AzureAuthenticationException
member.summary: Exception thrown when Azure CLI authentication fails or is missing. This is a USER ERROR - user needs to authenticate.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Exceptions.AzureResourceException
member.summary: Exception thrown when Azure resource creation/update fails. Could be user error (permissions) or system error (Azure outage).

member.summary: Exception thrown when Microsoft Graph API operations fail.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Helpers.ManifestHelper.GetRequiredScopesAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Reads toolingManifest.json and returns the unique list of scopes required by all MCP servers. Strategy: 1) If a server entry has an explicit "scope" property, use it. 2) Otherwise, use McpConstants.ServerScopeMappings.GetScopeAndAudience(serverName). 3) Always include "McpServersMetadata.Read.All".

member.name: T:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Helpers.ProjectSettingsSyncHelper
member.summary: Helper methods for syncing project settings from the deployment project.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Models.Agent365Config
member.summary:
Unified configuration model for Agent365 CLI. Merges static configuration (from a365.config.json) and dynamic state (from a365.generated.config.json).
DESIGN PATTERN: Hybrid Merged Model (Option C) - Static properties use 'init' (immutable after construction, from a365.config.json) - Dynamic properties use 'get; set' (mutable at runtime, from a365.generated.config.json) - ConfigService handles merge (load) and split (save) logic

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Models.Agent365Config.Validate
member.summary: Validates the configuration. Returns a list of error messages if invalid, or empty if valid.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Models.Agent365Config.TenantId
member.summary: Azure AD Tenant ID where resources will be created.

member.summary: Azure Subscription ID for resource deployment.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Models.Agent365Config.ResourceGroup
member.summary: Azure Resource Group name where all resources will be deployed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Models.Agent365Config.Location
member.summary: Azure region for resource deployment (e.g., "eastus", "westus2").

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Models.Agent365Config.Environment
member.summary: Target environment for Agent365 services (test, preprod, prod). Controls which endpoints are used for Teams Graph API, Agent 365 Tools, etc. Default: preprod

member.name: T:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Services.A365CreateInstanceRunner
member.summary: C# implementation fully equivalent to a365-createinstance.ps1. Supports all phases: Identity/User creation and License assignment. Native C# implementation - no PowerShell script dependencies. MCP permissions are configured via inheritable permissions during setup phase.

member.summary: Execute instance creation workflow. Fully compatible with a365-createinstance.ps1 -Step parameter.

member.summary: Create Agent Identity using Microsoft Graph API Replaces createAgenticUser.ps1 (identity creation part) IMPORTANT: Uses blueprint client credentials for authentication (application permissions required)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Services.A365CreateInstanceRunner.GetBlueprintAccessTokenAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Get access token for blueprint using client credentials flow (OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials Grant) This uses the blueprint's client ID and secret to authenticate as the application itself

member.summary: Unprotects (decrypts) a secret string that was encrypted using DPAPI on Windows. On non-Windows platforms, returns the input as-is (assumes plaintext).
member.param: Whether the secret was encrypted (from config metadata)
member.returns: The decrypted plaintext secret

member.param: Application (client) ID of the agent identity
member.returns: True if the service principal exists, false otherwise

member.name: T:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Services.A365SetupRunner
member.summary: C# implementation of a365-setup.ps1 with full feature parity. Handles infrastructure setup, blueprint creation, consent flows, and MCP server configuration.

member.summary:
Create Agent Blueprint using Microsoft Graph API (native C# implementation) Replaces createAgentBlueprint.ps1
IMPORTANT: This requires interactive authentication with Application.ReadWrite.All permission. Uses the same authentication flow as Connect-MgGraph in PowerShell.

member.summary: Configure MCP server API permissions (Step 6.5 from PowerShell script). This was missing in the original C# implementation.

member.summary: Create a client secret for the Agent Blueprint using Microsoft Graph API. Native C# implementation - no PowerShell dependencies. The secret is encrypted using DPAPI on Windows before storage.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Services.IConfigService
member.summary:
Service for loading, saving, and validating Agent365 configuration.
DESIGN PATTERN: Handles merge (load) and split (save) of two-file config model - LoadAsync: Merges a365.config.json + a365.generated.config.json to single Agent365Config - SaveStateAsync: Extracts dynamic properties to writes to a365.generated.config.json - ValidateAsync: Validates both static and dynamic configuration

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Services.IConfigService.LoadAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Loads and merges static configuration (a365.config.json) and dynamic state (a365.generated.config.json) into a single Agent365Config object.
member.param: Path to the static configuration file (default: a365.config.json)
Path to the generated state file (default: a365.generated.config.json)
member.returns: Merged configuration object with both static (init) and dynamic (get/set) properties

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Services.IConfigService.SaveStateAsync(Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Models.Agent365Config,System.String)
member.summary: Saves only the dynamic properties (get/set) from the config object to the generated state file. Static properties (init-only) are NOT saved as they should only be modified in a365.config.json.
member.param: Configuration object containing both static and dynamic properties
Path to the generated state file (default: a365.generated.config.json)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Services.IConfigService.ValidateAsync(Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Models.Agent365Config)
member.summary: Validates the configuration object, checking required properties, formats, and business rules.
member.returns: Validation result with success/failure and error messages

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Services.IConfigService.ConfigExistsAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the static configuration file exists.
member.param: Path to the static configuration file
member.returns: True if file exists, false otherwise

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Services.IConfigService.StateExistsAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the generated state file exists.
member.param: Path to the generated state file
member.returns: True if file exists, false otherwise

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Services.IConfigService.CreateDefaultConfigAsync(System.String,Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Models.Agent365Config)
member.summary: Creates a new static configuration file with default/template values. Useful for initialization scenarios.
member.param: Path where the configuration file should be created
Optional template config to use instead of defaults
member.exception: Thrown when file already exists or write fails

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Services.IConfigService.InitializeStateAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes an empty generated state file. Typically called during first-time setup.
member.param: Path where the state file should be created

member.name: T:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Services.InteractiveGraphAuthService
member.summary:
Provides interactive authentication to Microsoft Graph using browser authentication. This mimics the behavior of Connect-MgGraph in PowerShell which allows creating Agent Blueprints.
The key difference from Azure CLI authentication: - Azure CLI tokens are delegated (user acting on behalf of themselves) - This service gets application-level access through user consent - Supports AgentApplication.Create application permission
PURE C# IMPLEMENTATION - NO POWERSHELL DEPENDENCIES

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.A365.DevTools.Cli.Services.InteractiveGraphAuthService.GetAuthenticatedGraphClientAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Gets an authenticated GraphServiceClient using interactive browser authentication. This uses the Microsoft Graph PowerShell app ID to get the same elevated privileges.
PURE C# - NO POWERSHELL REQUIRED
